Pale Blue Dot
Earth as seen by Voyager 1 from more than 6.4 billion kilometers.

Look again at that dot. That's here. That's home. That's us. On it everyone you love, everyone you know, everyone you ever heard of, every human being who ever was, lived out their lives. The aggregate of our joy and suffering, thousands of confident religions, ideologies, and economic doctrines, every hunter and forager, every hero and coward, every creator and destroyer of civilization, every king and peasant, every young couple in love, every mother and father, hopeful child, inventor and explorer, every teacher of morals, every corrupt politician, every superstar, every supreme leader, every saint and sinner in the history of our species lived there -- on a mote of dust suspended in a sunbeam.
     --Carl Sagan, 1994

\n[b]Mouse
[indent]Mouse-wheel moves closer/further from target object.
Left-button drag to move around the target object.
Right-button* drag near screen center to pan left, right, up or down.
Right-button* drag near screen edge to rotate.
(*Cntr + mouse button on Mac.)[/indent]
\n[b]Controls & Links[/b]
[indent]Time Control - Move mouse to upper left
Selection Options - Move mouse to upper middle
Links/Help/Credits - Move mouse to upper right
Navigator - Move mouse to lower left
Settings - Move mouse to lower right[/indent]
\n[b]Hotkeys[/b]
[indent]Shift-arrows, P, Shift-P, M, Shift-M - these select the target body.
Arrows, Page Up, Page down - these move the camera.
Home, Delete, End - these change the viewpoint.
+, -, Backspace - these change simulator speed or reverse time.
Cntr-H - See or modify all hotkeys.[/indent]
\n[b]Asteroids[/b]
[indent]These are not (yet) selectable. The simulator shows all numbered
and multiposition asteroids filtered by magnitude. Note that magnitude
filter for Near-Earth and Mars-Crossers is much less restrictive than all
other groups. (We show only a tiny fraction of known Main Belt asteroids!)
